msContents.summary: a record of dike tax for the 11th year (fifth column); all individuals registered live outside the village.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is described

condition.ab: The top and bottom margins are intact; the right margin has been lost, but the partially preserved column vi was the last, both because it stops halfway down the page and because the names in col. vi correspond to those names in PPrinc. i 14, which are found just before the final total at v. 22. The traces of at least one more column can be seen at the left margin of the Michigan papyrus. The papyrus has 115 names, four of which are illegible in the sixth column by reason of a large hole.

handDesc.p: Four very faded columns written across the fibers. Two different hands. The second, third and fourth column were produced by the same hand.

origin.origPlace: Philadelphia, Polemon meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Labeous the younger, son of Onnophris
Herakles, son of Horos the shepherd
Herakles, son of Marres the shepherd
Nekpheros alias Panos, son of Panos
Mysthas the younger, son of Nekpheros

provenance.p: Philadelphia, Polemon meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
